pr_title: Added unit tests for the rca.net package

timeline.bodyText: Can someone comment on this behavior? Should we always terminate remote connections for passed host parameters regardless of whether the subscription manager is aware of the given graphNode?
timeline.author: sidheart

replies.bodyText: it's outside the if block only as a catch-all. In case only the RCA framework(not the JVM or the network threads) restarted and lost the subscription information, but the other side never knew about any such happenings on this node.
replies.author: ktkrg

timeline.message: Added unit tests for the rca.net package
Added unit tests for the rca.net package

timeline.bodyText:
If this is only for tests, can we check for the requestNode and destinationNode strings explicitly instead of overriding the equals methods ?
Otherwise in Java, with equals(), hashcode() needs to be implemented as well
timeline.author: yojs

replies.bodyText: Nice catch! I'll address this issue in the next PR.
replies.author: sidheart

replies.bodyText: This is a closed pull request ? I see that you closed it but then reopened it as well. Please consider closing it if it does not need to be reviewed any more.
replies.author: yojs

replies.bodyText: ^ I closed it because the FileGCTest failed, so to get the CI check to pass, I had to close and reopen the PR because CI is triggered on a submission.
replies.author: sidheart

replies.bodyText: I've removed the equals() methods on classes where they were unnecessary, and included hashcode() for classes where they were necessary.
replies.author: sidheart

timeline.bodyText: Can I suggest an alternative ? Can we add a prehook and post hook which will be empty and then for test we override these methods to set the variable and we can test it ? I assume this variable is only for test purposes only ?
timeline.author: yojs

timeline.bodyText: If this is for test only, can we annotate it as such ?
timeline.author: yojs

timeline.bodyText: we can probably avoid this copy here, right ? Although the test is the only one that needs it, the release code also pays the price for it.
timeline.author: yojs

timeline.bodyText: Should we make all the arguments final ?
timeline.author: yojs

replies.bodyText: Removed the constructor, used a test method to generate NodeDetails, the new test method takes final arguments
replies.author: sidheart

timeline.bodyText: This is good but I see that it's being used by test classes (and very rightly so). So, should we move it to the test packing instead of keeping it here ?
timeline.author: yojs

timeline.bodyText: We are missing a newline at the end of the file ?
timeline.author: yojs

timeline.bodyText: Why do we always name as uut ? :)
timeline.author: yojs

replies.bodyText: "unit under test", I'm used to that naming convention from Splunk. I don't feel strongly about it :)
replies.author: sidheart

timeline.bodyText: I don't quite understand what we are testing here. We should test for some expected value or else this test will always pass.
timeline.author: yojs

replies.bodyText: This is solely for test coverage of those methods, we can't verify the logic of methods which only log. If someone adds logic to these methods at a later date, the coverage will drop unless they implement appropriate test logic here.
replies.author: sidheart

timeline.bodyText: Is there a reason all these have to be static ?
timeline.author: yojs

replies.bodyText: I changed a few of them which didn't need to be static. The server startup stuff happens in the static @BeforeClass method
replies.author: sidheart

timeline.bodyText: How did we arrive at this number ? I have seen arbitrary sleeps make test cases flaky. And sometimes the tests take too long to run because there are multiple tests doing this. It might be a good idea to check for the expected value in a loop for some max timeouts where the sleeps between each iteration is in milliseconds. That way we don't wait more than we have to. and the timeout can be much longer than 3 seconds as we expect to break out of them early anyways
timeline.author: yojs

replies.bodyText: I've modified everything to be a uniform 1 second. Testing the mean on my local machine would likely differ from the mean on the CI runner, so I feel that 1s is a good uniform compromise.
replies.author: sidheart

replies.bodyText: Added the WaitFor class which is a basic reusable waiting poller
replies.author: sidheart
